formatDescription: A Finale (notation) document file used through Finale 2012. Enigma Binary File created for music notation software Finale. Finale was originally created for Coda Music Software, later sold to Net4Music which then became MakeMusic. Originally made for MacOS in 1988 it was later made available for Microsoft Windows. The Enigma stands for 'Environment for Notation Intuitive Graphic Music Algorithms'.
provenanceCompoundName: National Library of New Zealand / National Library of New Zealand
formatProvenance: 04/2024 (v.118)- Removed the string 'Finale ®' from signature as this can be replaced with the string 'PrintMusic ®', updated description, note field and added version number. Submitted by Brigham Young University.

internalSignatures.name: Enigma Binary File (Finale) 3+
internalSignatures.note: BOF; Offset: 0; Magic Bytes: 'Enigma Binary File'; Version info can be found within the file but this is a generic signature to cover all versions from 3 onwards.
